result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore B. Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $150 starting the first day of the first full month after release from custody. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.
No contact with Ace Hardware, Wautoma Rental, Tanya Derr and/or Lawrence Derr directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Uncharged Bail Jumping stemming from missed court appearance on January 5, 2015 dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Sentence to commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With Huber and Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.
Consecutive to: Count 2 and consecutive to any sentence currently being served.
Court reimposes costs not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.
Court enters civil judgment in favor of the victims.

10:31 am case called. Defendant Theodore B. Simmons in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Theodore B. Simmons in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding status. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. Statement by DA Anderson re: sentence credit. Chapter 950 compliance. Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. No statement by defendant. Court makes statement to defendant prior to sentencing. Court 6 months on each count, consecutive to each other and consecutive to any sentence currently being served. Credit for 129 days Time Served. Restitution to be re-imposed and civil judgment to be entered 1375 to Ace Hardware & 2500 to Wautoma Rental. Court re-imposes costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

Case called @ 3:10 p.m. Defendant Theodore B. Simmons in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Defendant Theodore B. Simmons in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Uncharged Bail Jumping - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Sulewski. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Ct 1 only - 90 days WCJ - Huber, NO GT,  11 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith. As to both counts: $3875 Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $150 beginning the first day of the first full month after release from custody, DE to maintain gainful employment, NC w/ Ace Hardware, Wautoma Rental, Tanya Derr and/or Lawrence Derr, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. No objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any pawning any items or the renting of any items from any business conducting a rental operation.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department and executed Signature Bond form to be returned by no later than December 22, 2015.  Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any pawning any items or the renting of any items from any business conducting a rental operation.

Case Called @ 2:07 PM: Defendant Theodore B. Simmons in court, appearing via telephone, with attorney Andrew John Sulewski, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is concerned that Def is again not appearing in person.  Per Atty Sulewski:  Appears Def was incarcerated in Waukesha Co and was just released and unable to be here in person.  Counsel has not yet been able to speak with his client.   Per ADA:  Newly filed 15CF1532 now filed in Waukesha Co - indicates IA was in fact yesterday with the entry of Signature Bond.  Defers to the Court on proceeding further.  Court entertains waiver of in person appearance for today's IA to be conducted.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of in person appearance.  IA to proceed via telephone.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered sua sponte appreciating Def now has counsel.   In person STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Court will not tolerate any further missed Court appearances - Def must appear in person at the next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Restitution Summary - $3875.00
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-15-2015 02:00 pm

Case Called @ 2:31 PM: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  In light of dual county court appearances today, adjournment requested.   Def had an appearance in Winnebago Co today and could not get here in time.  IA adjourned - NOH given.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
